title: Scientists Find Way to Make Tap Water Good

content.en: Very small pieces of plastic are in our tap water. These pieces are called microplastics. They are so small we can't see them. And they are in our bodies too. This is NOT good for us!
content.tw: 我們喝的水裡，有一些小到看不見的塑膠微粒，跑到身體裡對我們很不好喔！

content.en: What can we do about microplastics in our tap water? Some scientists have a good idea. Ask your parents to help with this!
content.tw: 該怎麼處理呢? 科學家們有個好點子，你可以請你爸媽來幫忙!

content.en: The scientists say to boil the water first. Make water very hot. Is it making big bubbles? It's boiling! Boil it for five minutes.
content.tw: 首先要把水煮沸。熱水開始冒泡泡之後，繼續煮五分鐘。

content.en: How does this help us take microplastics from the water? Well, water has minerals in it. After the water dries, sometimes we see something white. We see minerals. Microplastics stick to them.
content.tw: 這樣有什麼幫助呢？水煮完以後，我們會看到一些白色的東西，那是礦物質，而塑膠微粒會黏在上面。

content.en: Is this water ready to drink? Nope. The minerals and microplastics are still in it. But now it's easy to take them out.
content.tw: 這樣做還不夠，不過這些礦物質跟塑膠微粒很容易可以過濾出來。

content.en: How? Pour the water into a coffee filter. Be careful! And … 25% to 90% of microplastics are gone!
content.tw: 只要用咖啡濾紙小心地過濾自來水，就可以去除百分之 25 到 90 的塑膠微粒!

content.en: Let's boil and filter tap water before we drink it. This is good for us!
content.tw: 在喝自來水之前，讓我們將它煮沸並過濾。這對我們有益！

vocabulary.preface: 自來水裡面的細微塑膠顆粒，要處理掉並不難。

content.text:
1. tap water 自來水。
Hey, don't drink tap water. 嘿，不要喝自來水。
I know. I'm just too thirsty. 我知道，我只是太口渴了。

2. boil 煮。
Let me boil some water. 我來煮一點開水。
Then I can make oolong tea for you.然後來泡烏龍茶給你喝。
Thank you, tea would be lovely. 謝謝，喝茶很好。

3. minute 分鐘。
Just give me 10 minutes.只要給我十分鐘。
Here you are. 茶來了。
Ah, this is so nice! 真舒服!

4. drink 喝。
You know, I usually drink coffee. 我通常喝咖啡。
But this tea is better than any coffee.不過這個茶比什麼咖啡都好。
Great! I'm happy to hear that. 真棒，我很高興聽你這麼說。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天你學到哪些單字?
tap water自來水 boil煮 minute分鐘 drink喝

content.en: Have you been to Taroko Gorge? It's in Hualien. It's very beautiful.
content.tw: 你去過花蓮的太魯閣峽谷嗎?那裏很漂亮。

content.en: Taroko Gorge's name comes from the Taroko people. The Taroko people are one of the Indigenous Taiwanese peoples. Most live in Hualien.
content.tw: 太魯閣峽谷的名字來自一個原住民太魯閣族。

content.en: Some say the Taroko people first came to Taiwan's southwest coast. Tainan is there now. But Hualien is on the east coast of Taiwan. How did they come so far? And why?
content.tw: 傳說太魯閣族最早來到台灣的西南部，也就是現在的台南，但是現在他們住在台灣的東部花蓮，他們怎麼跑了這麼遠呢?

content.en: Not much was known about the Taroko people's past. Different people knew different parts of the Taroko people's past. But no one knew all of it.
content.tw: 沒有人了解太魯閣族全部的歷史，不同的人知道不同的部分。

content.en: A new book has changed this! It took more than ten years to write. The writer went to many Taroko groups. He talked with more than one hundred and eighty people!
content.tw: 但現在有一本關於他們歷史的書! 作者花了10 年以上，訪問了 180 多個太魯閣族人才寫完。

content.en: This book is important. It tells how and why the Taroko people went from the southwest to the east of Taiwan.
content.tw: 這本書很重要，它告訴我們太魯閣族搬到花蓮的原因還有過程。

content.en: The Taroko people have a great past. Thanks to this book, they can share their story with the world!
content.tw: 太魯閣族人有著輝煌的歷史。多虧了這本書，他們得以與世界分享他們的故事！

vocabulary.preface: 現在有一本新書，告訴讀者原住民太魯閣族人的歷史。

content.text:
1. write 寫作.
If I write a book about birds, would you buy
it?假如我寫一本有關鳥類的書，你會買嗎?
No.不會.
Why not? 為什麼不?
I'm not interested in birds.我對鳥兒沒有興趣.

2. past 過去.
What are you interested in? 你對什麼有興趣?
Your past.你的過去.
My past? 我的過去?
Yeah, what you did and how you became who you are.

3. why 為什麼.
Why do you want to read a book about me? 為何你想讀關於我的書?
I like to hear people's stories. 我喜歡聽別人的故事。

4. different 不同的.
I've never done anything great.我沒有做過什麼了不起的事.
Well, you're different from anyone I know. 你跟我認識的人都不一樣.
So I'd like to find out more.所以我想多知道一點。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學的單字有哪幾個?

content.en: Narrator: There's a brave dog in Peru. He is a hero at a gas station!
content.tw: 祕魯的一個加油站裡，有一隻勇敢的狗狗英雄!

content.en: The dog was a stray dog. He didn't have a home. He was thin, and he was hungry all the time.
content.tw: 牠本來是一隻無家可歸的流浪狗，而且一直挨餓。

content.en: Some kind workers at a gas station started giving him food. So the dog loves to go there.
content.tw: 有一些加油站員工會餵給牠食物，所以牠很愛跑去加油站。

content.en: One day, something very scary happened! Two bad people tried to take things from the gas station. Robber 1: Put the money in the bag! Narrator: They were robbers! But the dog came to the rescue!
content.tw: 有一天，兩個可怕的搶匪到加油站搶劫! 這時候，狗狗英雄出現了!

content.en: The robbers tried to scare the dog … Robber 2: Shoo! Go away! Narrator: … But he was brave! He barked loudly. He chased the robbers away! The workers were very thankful for the dog!
content.tw: 搶匪試著把牠嚇走，但牠很勇敢，邊叫邊把搶匪趕跑! 員工們都很感謝牠。

content.en: Now the dog is a guard at the gas station! He wears a red shirt with yellow sleeves. The workers wear a red shirt with yellow sleeves too! He wears an ID card with his picture.
content.tw: 現在這隻狗是加油站的警衛! 牠和其他員工一樣穿著制服，還有貼著牠的照片的員工證。

content.en: He has a nice doghouse. And now he gets breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day!
content.tw: 牠現在有家可以住，三餐也都吃得飽飽的!

content.en: This brave dog is an important worker at the gas station. He keeps everyone there safe!
content.tw: 這隻勇敢的狗是加油站的重要員工。牠保護那裡的每個人安全！

vocabulary.preface: 祕魯一隻流浪犬，救了加油站。

content.text:
1. breakfast 早餐。
Guess who showed up for breakfast today? 猜猜看今天誰來吃早餐？
Please tell me it wasn't another stray dog! 請告訴我不是另外一隻流浪狗。

2. stray dog 流浪犬。
It was! But this stray dog is different.牠是耶，不過這隻流浪狗不一樣。
All of them are the same for me.牠們對我來說都一樣。

3. bark 叫喊。
No, no, this one was very friendly. 不，這隻狗很友善。
It barked loudly as if saying "Hello"! 牠大聲叫，好像在說哈囉。
I find barking dogs scary. 我覺得一直叫的狗很恐怖。

4. chase away 趕走。
I'm thinking of keeping it. 我想要養牠。
It can chase away thieves. 牠會趕走小偷。
I'll move away before it does that. 我會在牠那樣做之前搬家。

vocabulary.postscript:
Are you afraid of dogs? 請來讀單字。
breakfast早餐 stray dog流浪犬 bark叫喊 chase away趕走
